headings: Prepare to join the exciting aviation industry!
Admission Requirements, Degree Plans and Courses
What Can You Do With a Commercial Aviation Degree?
Why Earn My Commercial Aviation Degree at Angelo State?
paragraphs: Can you see yourself captaining passenger airliners and seeing the world? Maybe you’d prefer to pilot a luxury private jet or deliver essential goods and supplies to those in need. Or maybe you’re drawn to the dynamic world of airport operations, managing logistics and making sure everything runs smoothly. Whether your dreams are in the air or on the ground, our comprehensive program will equip you with the knowledge and skills to excel in the fast-paced commercial aviation industry.

When you enroll at ASU, you will be joining one of the newest and fastest-growing aviation programs in Texas. It’s an incredible opportunity to take the first steps toward an exciting and fulfilling career in aviation.

Both degree tracks consist of 120 credit hours of coursework.
Additional Flight Operation Expenses and Requirements
Our professional faculty bring real-world experience to the classroom and the cockpit, so you’ll get a comprehensive view of aviation administration and operations.
Our partner Skyline Aviation is a Part 141 Flight School with professional instructors and the latest in aircraft, simulators and instructional equipment. It is also owned by ASU alumni.
Program Faculty and Staff
ASU Distinguished ScholarshipsOur premier scholarships are awarded based on your academic achievement, and you don’t even have to apply. You are automatically considered once you are admitted to ASU.
General ScholarshipsWe offer over 600 different types of scholarships. You can apply for both our general scholarships and degree-specific scholarships with one application.
Blue and Gold GuaranteeIf you have financial need, you may qualify forfree tuitionto attend Angelo State.
Begin working in the aviation industry as soon as you graduate. Federal studies project a need for nearly 800,000 new pilots over the next 20 years.
There will also be a high demand for airport, logistics and aviation managers, as well as in aviation operations and other administrative areas throughout the commercial aviation industry.

ASU is one of the select few partners in the Southwest Airlines Destination 225˚ pilot recruitment program. If you are accepted into the program and fulfill the requirements, upon earning your B.C.A. degree at ASU, you will enter a defined pathway toward a career with Southwest Airlines. You can apply for the program as early as your sophomore year. It’s one more aspect that makes us a premier commercial pilot school.

Our flight operations students learn flying skills at Skyline Aviation, a Part 141 Flight School with professional instructors and advanced, cutting-edge simulators and instructional equipment. The ASU fleet is one of the newest in the country, made up of Diamond aircraft, considered the safest training planes in the industry. For our aviation administration students, we have established partnerships with the San Angelo Airport, U.S. Customs and other key agencies, where you will gain practical skills and experience.
Sign up for a Hangar Tour

You can join our active Ram Air student organization for additional networking and professional development activities, as well as fun social events. Plus, in an industry that is white-male dominated, about a third of our students are female or minority. Joining Ram Air will help you form stronger bonds with your fellow students and professors, and give you a more global perspective.
Attend one of our Commercial Aviation Information Sessions to learn the basics of the program and get your questions answered.
Book an Information Session Online
